verses.verse: Whither is thy beloved <WH1730> gone <WH1980> <WH8804>, O thou fairest <WH3303> among women <WH802>? whither is thy beloved <WH1730> turned aside <WH6437> <WH8804>? that we may seek <WH1245> <WH8762> him with thee.

My beloved <WH1730> is gone down <WH3381> <WH8804> into his garden <WH1588>, to the beds <WH6170> of spices <WH1314>, to feed <WH7462> <WH8800> in the gardens <WH1588>, and to gather <WH3950> <WH8800> lilies <WH7799>.
I am my beloved's <WH1730>, and my beloved <WH1730> is mine: he feedeth <WH7462> <WH8802> among the lilies <WH7799>.
Thou art beautiful <WH3303>, O my love <WH7474>, as Tirzah <WH8656>, comely <WH5000> as Yerushalayim <WH3389>, terrible <WH366> as an army with banners <WH1713> <WH8737>.

Turn away <WH5437> <WH8685> thine eyes <WH5869> from me, for they <WH1992> have overcome <WH7292> <WH8689> me: thy hair <WH8181> is as a flock <WH5739> of goats <WH5795> that appear <WH1570> from Gil`ad <WH1568>.

Thy teeth <WH8127> are as a flock <WH5739> of sheep <WH7353> which go up <WH5927> <WH8804> from the washing <WH7367>, whereof every one beareth twins <WH8382> <WH8688>, and there is not one barren <WH7909> among them.
As a piece <WH6400> of a pomegranate <WH7416> are thy temples <WH7541> within <WH1157> thy locks <WH6777>.
There are threescore <WH8346> queens <WH4436>, and fourscore <WH8084> concubines <WH6370>, and virgins <WH5959> without number <WH4557>.

My dove <WH3123>, my undefiled <WH8535> is but one <WH259>; she is the only one <WH259> of her mother <WH517>, she is the choice <WH1249> one of her that bare <WH3205> <WH8802> her. The daughters <WH1323> saw <WH7200> <WH8804> her, and blessed <WH833> <WH8762> her; yea, the queens <WH4436> and the concubines <WH6370>, and they praised <WH1984> <WH8762> her.

Who is she that looketh forth <WH8259> <WH8737> as the morning <WH7837>, fair <WH3303> as the moon <WH3842>, clear <WH1249> as the sun <WH2535>, and terrible <WH366> as an army with banners <WH1713> <WH8737> ?

I went down <WH3381> <WH8804> into the garden <WH1594> of nuts <WH93> to see <WH7200> <WH8800> the fruits <WH3> of the valley <WH5158>, and to see <WH7200> <WH8800> whether the vine <WH1612> flourished <WH6524> <WH8804>, and the pomegranates <WH7416> budded <WH5132> <WH8689>.
Or ever I was aware <WH3045> <WH8804>, my soul <WH5315> made <WH7760> <WH8804> me like the chariots <WH4818> of Amminadib <WH5993>.

Return <WH7725> <WH8798>, return <WH7725> <WH8798>, O Shulamite <WH7759>; return <WH7725> <WH8798>, return <WH7725> <WH8798>, that we may look <WH2372> <WH8799> upon thee. What will ye see <WH2372> <WH8799> in the Shulamite <WH7759>? As it were the company <WH4246> of two armies <WH4264>.
